abstract.text: Manages periodic update messages for all component objects of a specified class.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object manages periodic update messages for components in a game that uses Entity-Component architecture. Use a component system to perform per-frame logic for all components of a specific class without traversing your game’s object hierarchy to dispatch update messages.
object manages components of a specific
subclass. You create a component system with the
initializer, specifying the component class it will work with. Then, you register the components used by the entities in your game with the
methods. The component system will then forward any component-specific messages it receives to all registered instances of its component class.
The most important of the component-specific messages is the
method. Call this method from your game’s update/render loop—that is, from a method such as
(macOS) timer in a custom rendering engine. The component system then forwards to the
subclass instances it manages, allowing those objects to perform per-frame update logic.
For more information on Entity-Component architecture, read

abstract.text: A reference to a display link object.
A timer object that allows your app to synchronize its drawing to the refresh rate of the display.
Tells the delegate to perform any updates that need to occur before actions, animations, and physics are evaluated.
Tells your app to perform any app-specific logic to update your scene.
Architect and organize your game logic. Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.
The abstract superclass for creating objects that add specific gameplay functionality to an entity.
Performs any custom periodic actions defined by the component subclass.
Manages periodic update messages for all component objects of a specified class.
Adds a component instance to the component system.
Adds any instances of the component system’s component class in the specified entity to the component system.
The class of components managed by the component system.
The component system’s list of components.
Initializes a component system to manage components of the specified class.
Removes the specified component instance from the component system.
Removes any instances of the component system’s component class in the specified entity from the component system.
Returns the component at the specified index in the system’s list of components.
Tells all component instances managed by the system to perform their custom periodic actions.
An object relevant to gameplay, with functionality entirely provided by a collection of component objects.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to support fast enumeration.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
